cards.front: What are the four amplifier types?
Ideal R_in and R_out for a voltage amplifier?
cards.back: R_in → ∞ (don't load source), R_out → 0 (all voltage to load)

cards.front: Ideal R_in and R_out for a current amplifier?
cards.back: R_in → 0 (all current through amp), R_out → ∞ (all current to load)

cards.front: Output loading formula for voltage amplifier?
cards.back: V_out = A_V · V_in × R_L/(R_L + R_out). Voltage divider between R_out and R_L.

cards.front: Output loading formula for current amplifier?
cards.back: I_out = A_I · I_in × R_out/(R_out + R_L). Current divider between R_out and R_L.

cards.front: When do we use Thévenin vs Norton output model?
cards.back: Thévenin for voltage output (voltage + transresistance). Norton for current output (current + transconductance).

cards.front: What universal requirement must ALL amplifiers satisfy?
cards.back: Power gain P_out/P_in > 1. An amplifier must always increase power, even if voltage or current gain is < 1.
R_in → ∞ (voltage input, don't load), R_out → ∞ (current output, don't shunt). Both infinite!
